messages.content: What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?
A river.
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
The letter m.
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
Darkness.
What has hands but can not clap?
A clock.
What can be filled with empty hands?
Gloves.
What has a heart that doesn’t beat?
An artichoke.
What begins with an e and only contains one letter?
An envelope.
What is so delicate that saying its name breaks it?
Silence.
You measure my life in hours and I serve you by expiring. I’m quick when I’m thin and slow when I’m fat. The wind is my enemy. What am I?
A candle.
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
A map.
What has legs, but doesn’t walk?
A table.
What has one eye but can’t see anything at all?
A needle.
What has a head and a tail but no body?
A coin.
What has keys but can't open locks?
A piano.
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
Light.
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
A glove.
What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
A promise.
I come from a mine and get surrounded by wood always. Everyone uses me. What am I?
Pencil lead.
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
A bank.
What can travel all around the world without leaving its corner?
A stamp.
What has to be broken before you can use it?
An egg.
I am tall when I am young, and I am short when I am old. What am I?
A candle.
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
A penny.
What has a neck but no head?
A bottle.
What gets wetter as it dries?
A towel.
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
A stamp.
What has many keys but cant open a single lock?
A piano.
What can you catch, but not throw?
A cold.
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
Silence.
What has words, but never speaks?
A book.
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have nobody, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
An echo.
You see a boat filled with people. It has not sunk, but when you look again you don’t see a single person on the boat. Why?
All the people were married.
What has many teeth but can’t bite?
A comb.
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. What am I?
A cloud.
Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
The word ton.
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
The future.
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for more than 5 minutes. What am I?
Breath.
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you haven't got me. What am I?
A secret.
What can be broken, but is never held?
A promise.
What has one eye, but can’t see?
A needle.
